arm_variations.description: Start in a push-up plank position with your body in a straight line. Move sideways by stepping one hand and the opposite foot to the side, followed by the other hand and foot. Continue walking sideways in a controlled motion, keeping your core tight and hips level throughout.

arm_variations.exercise: Push-Up Plank: Lift Arm and Leg on Same Side, Switch Sides
arm_variations.description: Start in a push-up plank position. Lift your arm and the leg on the same side simultaneously, keeping your body stable and core engaged. Hold briefly, then lower them back down and repeat on the opposite side. This exercise enhances balance, coordination, and core strength.

arm_variations.exercise: Push-Up Plank with Opposite Arm and Leg Lift
arm_variations.description: Start in a push-up plank position. Slowly lift one arm and the opposite leg simultaneously, extending them straight in front of you. Hold briefly while keeping your core engaged and hips level, then lower back down and switch sides. This move improves balance, stability, and core strength.

Start in a high plank position on your hands. Slowly lower your body down onto your forearms one arm at a time, then press back up to the starting plank position. Keep your core engaged and maintain a straight line from head to heels throughout the movement.

Begin in a reverse plank position with your hands and feet on the ground, hips lifted so your core is off the ground. Move by simultaneously walking your hands and feet forward or backward while keeping your torso elevated and off the ground throughout the movement.

Start in a reverse plank position. Move one leg under your body while simultaneously rotating your arm over your torso. Flip your body to rotate between facing the ground (belly down) and facing up (back down). When performed correctly, your body moves in a circle.
Wide-arm push-up variation to target the chest and shoulders.
Diamond push-up to focus on the triceps and inner chest.
Push-up variation performed on fists to strengthen the wrists and arms.
Push-up performed on fingers to build finger and hand strength.
Front-facing push-up for chest and core engagement.
Clap push-up to develop explosive power in the upper body.
One-handed push-up for increased upper body strength and balance.
Narrow push-up to target the triceps and chest more intensely.
Tricep dips performed on a bench to target the triceps.
One-arm plank punch to build core and arm stability.
Reverse handstand push-up against the wall for shoulder and upper body strength.

stamina.description: Start in a Pu Bu (low side stance) to the right with your left arm extended low in front and your right arm pulled back and up. As you switch to Pu Bu on the other side, perform a circular motion—pulling the left arm up and the right arm down simultaneously. Repeat the movement on the opposite side, switching back into Pu Bu, this time with the right arm rising and the left arm lowering in a smooth, continuous circular flow. Focus on coordination, fluid transitions, and maintaining strong, rooted stances.
Execute 200 snap kicks, alternating sides to ensure balanced strength and technique. Focus on quick, controlled kicks with proper form and flexibility throughout the exercise.
Execute 200 controlled knee strikes, focusing on proper form, balance, and power with each strike.

stamina.exercise: Mabu stance double forward punch, side double palm strike, then bring hands up and return to hips
stamina.description: Begin in Mabu (horse) stance. Execute a strong double forward punch, followed by a side double palm strike. Finally, raise your hands upward and powerfully bring them back to rest at your hips, maintaining balance and control throughout.

stamina.exercise: Mabu Taichi - open palms porward Punch
stamina.description: Stand in mabu position. Bring both arms to one side, then punch forward with palms facing inward, keeping the hands horizontal. Use a sharp hip movement to add power. At the end of the motion, allow the hands to continue naturally, and let the body relax and sink.

stamina.exercise: Mabu Taichi – open palms porward Punch
stamina.description: Stand in mabu position. Bring both arms to one side, then punch forward with palms facing inward, keeping the hands horizontal. Use a sharp hip movement to add power. At the end of the motion, allow the hands to continue naturally, and let the body relax and sink.
Mabu punch. For coordination and upper body strength.
Mabu punch combo 2 punshes. For coordination and upper body strength.
Mabu punch combo 3 punshes. For coordination and upper body strength.
switch between mabu and gong bu  and switch punshes
switch between mabu and gong bu and switch punshes

stamina.exercise: mabu gong bu grab and punch
stamina.description: switch between mabu and gong bu in mabu block in gong bu grab and punch

stamina.exercise: mabu gong bu hands on back
stamina.description: switch between mabu and gong bu with the hands on the back

stamina.exercise: mabu gong bu hands on back
stamina.description: switch between mabu and gong bu with the hands on the back
A round punch technique for practicing rotational power.
Basic punshing excersise stepping out in pu bu and punch right, one leg up punsh left, back to mabu punch right, gongbu one knee on ground punch right, step back legs together punch in hand

leg.description: Start in a squat position, then explode upward into a jump. As you land, squad and immediately perform a snap kick with one leg. Alternate legs with each rep. Focus on explosive power during the jump and sharp, controlled form during the kick.

leg.exercise: Arms Wide Step Out in Mabu
leg.description: Start in a Mabu (horse) stance with your feet shoulder-width apart. Step one foot out to widen your stance while extending your arms wide for balance and stability. Focus on maintaining a strong, rooted posture throughout the movement.
Step one leg forward, bend both knees, and lower until your back knee nearly touches the ground. Press back up and repeat on the same leg for the set number of reps, then switch to the other leg.
Switch between different stances while performing kicks.
Jump down into a squat position and back up.
A full body exercise that combines a squat, push-up, and jump.
Perform squats to strengthen the legs and glutes.
Jump vertically to improve explosive leg strength.
Walk in a low stance to engage the legs and core.
Hamstring stretch with one leg extended forward.
Hamstring stretch with one leg extended backward.
Hamstring stretch with one leg extended to the side.
Ankle lifts to strengthen the lower leg and improve balance.
Perform a side kick followed by a rolling motion.
Single leg squat to improve strength and balance on one leg.

leg.exercise: jump 360 degrees and land in mabu
leg.description: 360-degree jump landing in a horse stance (mabu).
Perform a 360-degree jump.
Get up from a lying position using leg strength.
Walking through various stances to improve leg strength.
Perform a side kick while in a squat position.
A push kick performed from a squat position.

partner-excersises.exercise: 1. Lie on Back with Legs Raised, 2. Partner Presses Legs Down
partner-excersises.description: One partner lies on their back with legs raised vertically, actively resisting as their partner applies downward pressure on the legs. The goal is to bring the legs back up against the resistance, engaging and strengthening the core and lower abdominal muscles. Switch roles after completing the set.

One partner performs sit-ups while simultaneously throwing uppercut punches. The other partner holds their palms up to catch and absorb the punches. Switch roles after a set number of reps to build core strength and punching accuracy.
While performing sit-ups, one partner throws hook punches that the other partner catches with their palms. Partners alternate roles to improve coordination, core strength, and controlled punching.
During sit-ups, one partner throws straight punches while the other holds palms up to catch them. Switch roles regularly to develop core stability, timing, and hand speed.

partner-excersises.exercise: 1. Mabu Punch Fist, 2. Mabu Press Fist
partner-excersises.description: Partner 1 presses fists in Mabu (horse) stance while Partner 2 resists with a press using their palms in Mabu stance. Focus on maintaining balance, posture, and controlled power throughout the exchange.
Both partners stand in Kongu stance, grip each other's arms firmly, and pull with maximum effort to build strength and stability in the stance.

partner-excersises.exercise: 1. Press Arms Down - 2. Squat While Pressing
partner-excersises.description: Partner 1 holds their arms straight out in front and tries to keep them extended. Partner 2 presses down on their arms while performing squats. Maintain control and coordination throughout the movement.
Stand back-to-back with a partner in Mabu (horse) stance. Apply pressure against each other’s backs, engaging your legs and core to maintain balance and build strength.

hip.exercise: Static Snapkick Training
hip.description: Lie on your side with your lower leg extended straight. Bend your upper leg and hold your foot or ankle with your hand. Apply pressure with the bent leg as if performing a snapkick, but use your hand to hold the leg back, creating resistance to strengthen the kicking muscles.

hip.exercise: Balance on One Leg – Low Kick Front, Side, Outward
hip.description: Stand on one leg and perform low kicks to the front, side, and outward angles with the other leg. Keep your core engaged and maintain balance with controlled movements.

hip.exercise: Balance on One Leg - Hip outward Turns
hip.description: Stand on one leg and slowly rotate your hip outward while maintaining your balance. Keep your core engaged and movements controlled.

hip.exercise: Balance on One Leg - Hip inward Turns
hip.description: Stand on one leg and slowly rotate your hip inward while maintaining your balance. Keep your core engaged and movements controlled.

hip.exercise: on back legs split wide and close
hip.description: Lying down on your back while opening and closing your legs for inner hip strength.

hip.exercise: standing knee press up with weight
hip.description: Standing while pressing one knee up with added weight for resistance.

hip.exercise: one leg squat
hip.description: Single leg squat to improve strength and stability in the hips and legs.

hip.exercise: sit on the ground, legs wide, lift leg
hip.description: Sitting on the ground with legs wide apart and raising one leg upwards.

hip.exercise: sit on the ground, extend legs straight and lift up
hip.description: Sitting on the ground with legs extended straight and lifting them upward.

hip.exercise: sit on the ground, extend legs straight, lift up and to the side
hip.description: Sitting on the ground with legs extended straight and lifting them to the side.

hip.exercise: lying on back, leg up 90 degrees
hip.description: Lying on the back with one leg lifted at a 90-degree angle.

hip.exercise: normal bridge
hip.description: Normal bridge exercise performed lying on the back with knees bent, lifting the body upwards.

hip.exercise: bridges 1 leg
hip.description: Single leg bridge exercise, lying on the back with one leg raised while lifting the body.

hip.exercise: bridges 1 leg with one leg over the other
hip.description: Bridge exercise with one leg over the other while lifting the body.

hip.exercise: pubu step left and right
hip.description: Stepping out to the left and right from a low stance to engage the hips.

hip.exercise: lying on side, leg up
hip.description: Lying on the side with one leg lifted to target the hip muscles.

hip.exercise: lying on side, leg back and forth
hip.description: Lying on the side and moving the leg back and forth for hip mobility.

hip.exercise: lying on side, leg circles
hip.description: Lying on the side and making circular movements with the leg.

hip.exercise: lying on side, legs bent, lift leg to open hip
hip.description: Lying on the side with bent legs, lifting one leg to open the hip.

hip.exercise: lying on side, knee over leg, lift leg
hip.description: Lying on the side with one knee over the other leg while lifting the lower leg.

hip.exercise: kneeling, body lean backward
hip.description: Kneeling and leaning the body backward to stretch the hip flexors.

hip.exercise: lying on stomach, lift one leg
hip.description: Lying on the stomach and lifting one leg upwards.

hip.exercise: lying on stomach, lift both legs
hip.description: Lying on the stomach and lifting both legs upwards for lower back and hip strength.

hip.exercise: on hands and knees, leg side to side
hip.description: On hands and knees, moving the leg from side to side for hip mobility.

hip.exercise: lying on stomach, legs up, inward and outward
hip.description: Lying on the stomach with legs lifted, moving them inward and outward.

hip.exercise: on hands and knees, leg up and down
hip.description: On hands and knees, lifting and lowering the leg for glute activation.

hip.exercise: on hands and knees, bent leg side lift
hip.description: On hands and knees, lifting a bent leg to the side to target the hip.

core.description: Begin in a plank position supporting your body weight on one arm. Slowly lift the opposite leg off the ground, keeping your body straight and core engaged. Hold briefly, then lower the leg and switch sides to strengthen your core and improve balance.
Lie on your back with your legs lifted off the ground. Move your legs in a pedaling motion as if cycling in the air. Keep your lower back pressed to the floor and core engaged throughout.

Lie on your back with your hands behind your head and legs lifted. Bring one knee toward your chest while twisting your torso to touch the opposite elbow to the knee. Alternate sides in a pedaling motion, keeping your core tight.

Lie on your back with your hands under your hips. Lift both legs a few inches off the ground, then alternate crossing one leg over the other in a scissor-like motion. Keep your core engaged and your lower back pressed to the floor throughout the movement.

Lie on your back with your arms extended overhead. First, crunch up by bringing your knees and arms toward each other. From this position, perform a double snap kick, then lower your arms and legs back down with control.
Short sit-up focusing on upper abdominal engagement with a limited range of motion.
Full sit-up involving a complete range of motion to strengthen the entire abdominal area.
Side punch to the left, engaging the obliques and core stability.
Side punch to the right, targeting the obliques and enhancing rotational strength.
Flutter kicks while lying on your back to target the lower abs.
Lying on your back, reaching for your toes to engage the upper and lower abs.
Standard plank exercise to strengthen the core, shoulders, and back.
Side plank variations, engaging the obliques and improving core stability.
Lying on your side, lifting the legs to engage the obliques and hip flexors.
Lying on your back, lifting both legs to engage the lower abdominal muscles.

core.exercise: hold legs up and lift torso
core.description: Holding the legs up while lifting the torso to engage the entire core.
Lying on your back, moving the legs in a circular motion to work the lower abs.

stances.description: A traditional horse stance that strengthens the legs and builds endurance.
A forward lunge stance used for stability and transitioning in forms.
A stance where one leg bears most of the weight, used to build balance and flexibility.
A low stance stretching one leg while the other remains bent, developing flexibility and strength.
A cross-legged stance, emphasizing leg strength and mobility.
A stance where the legs are crossed, promoting balance and coordination.
A balancing stance used for transitioning in martial arts forms.
A stance where one knee is raised, focusing on balance and hip strength.
A wide stance where the body lowers into a seated position, building leg strength and endurance.

basics.description: A foundational horse stance that builds strength and stability.
A horse stance combined with an elbow strike to train power and coordination.
A low stance to improve flexibility and leg strength.
A low stance followed by an elbow strike for developing combined flexibility and striking ability.
A cross-legged stance with a defensive block and punch to enhance agility and response.
A cat stance with a thrust motion to train precision and balance.
A block followed by a double punch for practicing defensive and offensive combinations.

basics.exercise: basic 8: swing kick block double punch to the side
basics.description: A sequence of swinging kick, block, and double punch to the side, focusing on coordination.
A push kick used for creating distance and training leg strength.
A thrust combined with a spinning kick for dynamic movement.
Arm movements followed by a turn to train fluidity and upper body coordination.
A sweeping motion on the ground to improve flexibility and leg control.
A spinning kick performed with a jump for practicing explosive power.
A spinning kick paired with a block to train multi-tasking in defense and offense.
A double palm sweeping motion for practicing defensive techniques.
A sweeping motion transitioning into a low stance, enhancing fluidity and flexibility.

basics.exercise: basic 17: thrust turn with arms (five-step form)
basics.description: A thrust followed by a turn with arm movements in a five-step form, focusing on flow and technique.
A backward kick to train balance and rear defense.

beginner_forms.description: Basic foundational form for stance work.
Basic continuous form focusing on fluid transitions.
Basic linking step form for coordination and flow.

beginner_forms.exercise: vorm 4 Ba Bu Lian Bu Quan
beginner_forms.description: Eight-step linking form for balance and control.
Small Red Fist form with basic combat applications.

higher_forms.description: Small Red Fist form with more advanced combat applications.
Zhao Yang Fist form, focused on agility and power.
Tong Bei Fist form emphasizing power from the back.
Luohan Quan form, representing the spirit of the Arhat.
Qi Xin Fist form, focusing on internal strength and stability.
Qi Xin Fist form, focusing on internal strength and stability.

weapon_forms.description: Long staff form emphasizing sweeping techniques.
Hidden Hand Staff form with complex techniques.
Single Sabre form with powerful strikes.
Spear form with thrusts and agile maneuvers.
Light Breeze Sword form focused on grace and precision.
Fan form incorporating defense and flexibility.
Pu Dao form using a polearm with cutting techniques.

tai_chi_forms.description: A foundational Tai Chi form with 18 movements from the Chen style.
A soft and flowing form emphasizing circular movements.

tai_chi_weapon_forms.description: A Tai Chi form incorporating fan techniques with 24 movements.
A Chen style Tai Chi form focusing on dao (sword) techniques with 13 movements.

harding.exercise: Fist Push-Up with Double Floor Punch, Switching Hands
harding.description: Begin in a fist push-up position. After completing the push-up, punch the floor twice—once with each hand—alternating sides each rep. Focus on controlled movements, maintaining a strong plank posture, and generating power from the core and shoulders.
